attributes.action: make an URGENT PUBLIC STATEMENT to reassure the public that despite so many of his colleagues making so many mistakes in their expenses claims in the last 8 or so years there have been no mistakes in the decisions over activities affecting the country such as the invasion of Iraq; the nuclear fuel debate; the Trident replacement debate - the list is endless
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: It is unconchable that so many people in positions of trust and authority can have made so many mistakes in their personal lives that they cannot also have made mistakes in their professional lives.  How can anybody on the floor of the House of Commons be trusted to be honest.  This is what Mr Brown needs to reassure the voters about now OR he could let us make our own mistakes and give us an immediate general election to find out if we are willing to allow the current lot to continue making their mistakes.

rejection.details: The Prime Minister already makes regular statements.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
